title: The Challenger Disaster: When Engineers Are Ignored
description: A 60-second lesson on The Challenger Disaster: When Engineers Are Ignored.

hook.text: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 73 seconds after launch. Seven crew members died.

buildup.text: Engineers at Morton Thiokol warned that cold weather would cause O-ring seals in the rocket boosters to fail.

discovery.text: The O-rings were designed for warmer temperatures. At 36Â°F, they lost elasticity and couldn't seal the joint.

twist.text: Managers overruled the engineers' objections to launch. Schedule pressure beat technical judgment.

punchline.text: The O-ring worked perfectly in every test. Except the one that mattered.
